text.text_load_null: [MAIN] Translation file not specified, use default language
text.items_load_null: [MAIN] Items file not specified, use default set
text.load_database_item_zero_items: banner loading error: not a single item is loaded

text.twitch_load_users_total: [TWITCH] Data uploaded. The total number of users in the database:
text.twitch_self_wishes_enabled: [TWITCH] Bot self-wishes are enabled every %d sec.
text.twitch_event_connect_error: [TWITCH] Failed to connect to channel points [ %d ] -> %s
text.token_check_error: wrong token or it has expired
text.token_refresh_ok: [TWITCH] Token successfully updated, twitch bot will be restarted..
text.twitch_backend_error_note:
[TWITCH] Failed to automatically update the twitch token, the reason should be the line above ^^^
[TWITCH] Now you can close the application and restart it - the error may disappear,
[TWITCH] or try deleting the "auth.json" file to try to create twitch tokens again
[TWITCH] You can also create tokens manually, the instructions are available on the project"s github page
[TWITCH] There you can also report this error (highly recommended)
text.twitch_token_expire_notify: [TWITCH] Twitch token for "%s" will expire in %d sec.
text.log_gacha_created: [GACHA] Created gacha with params: w:%d g4:%d g5:%d w4:%d w5:%d
text.log_db_created: [DB] Created a new connection to the database
text.log_db_table_create: [DB] There is no user table, we create it..
text.log_db_old_update: [DB] The version of the database is out of date, update the table: %s
text.log_db_old_import: [DB] Started downloading data from the old database (<=1.3)
text.log_panel_created: [PANEL] A new animation control panel was created
text.log_panel_init_wish_params: [PANEL] Fall animation has params: wish_stars=%s, multi=%s
text.log_panel_init_load_time: [PANEL] Initial data for the animation loaded in %d sec.

text.history_error_c3: %s you"re not in the wish history yet, try later :(

text.html_history_template_not_found: [HTML] Template for wish history not found: %s
text.auth_start_promt: Unable to find "auth.json" file, start authorization on Twitch?
text.auth_channel_promt: Enter name of channel where simulator will be used (only nickname, not link to channel):
text.auth_channel_separ: Will we use one account for chat-bot and channel points?
text.auth_bot_type_both: chat-bot and streamer account for channel points
text.auth_browser_promt:
Now a new tab will be opened in standard web browser
This will request access to bot"s account
Make sure to check following:

- address in address bar should be: "id.twitch.tv"
- application name: "Genshin Wish Simulator"
- on page must be nickname of account that you want to use as bot

>>> Now we are setting up an account for: %s <<<
text.auth_browser_close: Confirm access in web browser window that opens and ONLY then press OK button
text.auth_gate_error: Failed to query gate for a token!
text.auth_token_error: Failed to create token. The reason was stated in browser window after logging in
text.auth_create_success: All went fine, account is set up
text.auth_end:
Account data is stored in "auth.json"
Do not pass this file on to anyone and do not show its contents on stream!
To start setting up accounts again, simply delete "auth.json" from simulator folder
text.auth_force_test: No auth data found, enabled test mode
text.ui_update_message: Update available, visit GitHub page to download!
text.ui_settings_restored_success:
Config file restored successfully!
Simulator must be restarted
